meanings.definition: The direction that Muslims face when praying, towards the Kaaba in Mecca.
meanings.sent1: During prayer, Muslims always face the qibla.
meanings.sent2: She carefully aligned her prayer mat towards the qibla.
meanings.sent3: The birds seemed to know the qibla too, facing the same way on the tree branches.
meanings.sent4: His heart always pointed towards her like the qibla towards Mecca.
meanings.sent5: The magnetic pull of the qibla drew him closer to his faith.

meanings.definition: The point on the horizon to which a Muslim faces during prayer.
meanings.sent1: At sunset, the Imam pointed out the qibla to the congregation.
meanings.sent2: The traveler adjusted his compass to find the qibla in the unfamiliar land.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the qibla was a secret treasure to find.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes searched the horizon, seeking the qibla like a lost dream.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset painted the sky in the colors of the qibla.
